qas.question: Who is the person that started the religion that separated itself from the Catholic Church in the 17th century ?
What did he do that sparked the separation from the Catholic Church  ?
What did this leader of change believe of the conception of Mary ?

answers.text: Mother Mary, like us, was born in sin of sinful parents, but the Holy Spirit covered her, sanctified and purified her

qas.question: What did Mary's child avoid according to the leader of the separation ?

answers.text: this child was born of flesh and blood, but not with sinful flesh and blood.

qas.question: What particular sect is a patron of this belief ?

answers.text: Some Lutherans, such as the members of the Anglo-Lutheran Catholic Church, support the doctrine.

qas.question: What protestant reformer said that Mary was not born with sinful flesh?

plausible_answers.text: remain a true, natural human being of flesh and blood, just as we.

qas.question: What did the immaculate conception permit Mary to do?
What Lutherans do not support this doctrine?

plausible_answers.text: so that this child was born of flesh and blood, but not with sinful flesh

qas.question: Why did the Holy Spirit purify Jesus?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Martin Luther<a0_0/>,<b5_0/> who initiated the <a1_0>Protestant Reformation<a1_0/>, said: "<a2_0>Mother Mary, like us, was born in sin of sinful parents, but the Holy Spirit covered her, sanctified and purified her<a2_0/> <b8_0>so that <a3_0>this child was born of flesh and blood, but not with sinful flesh<b8_0/> and blood.<a3_0/> The Holy Spirit permitted the Virgin Mary to <b6_0>remain a true, natural human being of flesh and blood, just as we.<b6_0/> However, he warded off sin from her flesh and blood so that she became the mother of a pure child, not poisoned by sin as we are. For in that moment when she conceived, she was a holy mother filled with the Holy Spirit and her fruit is a holy pure fruit, at once God and truly man, in one person." <a4_0>Some Lutherans, such as the members of the <b7_0>Anglo-Lutheran Catholic Church,<b7_0/> support the doctrine.
